summary: Based on the provided documents, Linda C. Cipriani appears to be a CIA employee involved in the agency's compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act and interactions with the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents suggest she played a role in the review, declassification, and release of JFK assassination records, as well as in addressing concerns raised by the ARRB regarding the CIA's compliance with the Act. She is mentioned in the context of ARRB meetings, the release of JFK documents, foreign government liaison and information, briefings of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI) on denied JFK documents, and correspondence regarding the CIA's compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act.
key_connections: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI)
significance: Linda C. Cipriani's significance in the JFK context lies in her role as a CIA employee involved in the declassification and release of JFK assassination records, and in the CIA's interactions with the ARRB regarding compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act.
